page.title: 10Entertainment in Guildford
page.content:
{The Odeon}was designed by Andrew Mather and was built in 1935 on the site of a large Victorian house. It started off with one large auditorium but now there are three. Two small studios hold 135 people each and a large studio holds 452 people. Family films are the most popular. Holidays are the most popular viewing times.
{The Civic Hall}is the largest in Surrey. It was built to house the newly formed Philarmonic Orchestra in 1962. Gradually, one hall became multi-purpose and is used for such things as pop concerts, charity events, wrestling, discos, dances and fashion shows. The seating capacity is 2080 in the hall and balcony. The county suite and bar seats 100 people. The foyer also serves as a tourist information centre.
